🤔 How did we evacuate over 2,500 patients in 2022 from the frontlines in Ukraine, to safer places where they could receive medical care?

By retrofitting a train!

🤔 Who made it possible?

Our amazing colleagues ⬇️ pic.twitter.com/FA8L3YIUdH

— MSF International (@MSF) August 1, 2023

1686288009811861504.html:
Mariia Shabat was one of the nurses who cared for patients on the train in 2022. Thanks to her, and the rest of the team, patients were made comfortable and cared for around the clock... pic.twitter.com/WhuthXQbgO

— MSF International (@MSF) August 1, 2023

1686288012404051968.html:
Dr Guadalupe Garcia Noria is from Mexico. Here she is inside the medical train on the journey to Pokrovsk, in eastern Ukraine, where the team picks up war-wounded patients and transports them to hospitals in safer areas of western Ukraine... pic.twitter.com/3CbtVs7g2T

— MSF International (@MSF) August 1, 2023

1686288014949900288.html:
In 2022, Yasser Kamaledin was the project coordinator. Here he's seen inside the inpatient department of the medical train. He helped make security decisions to ensure everyone was moved safely from the frontlines to western Ukraine... pic.twitter.com/BPp6L8VQSA

— MSF International (@MSF) August 1, 2023

1686288017848233984.html:

🔴 Today a hospital that we have a partnership with in the Kherson region of Ukraine was shelled, resulting in a Ministry of Health doctor being killed. The operating theatre suffered a direct hit... 🧵

— MSF International (@MSF) August 1, 2023

1686360614094901249.html:
Our teams have been working in the hospital supplying medical equipment and providing mental health consultations to people displaced by the destruction of the Kakhovka Dam...

— MSF International (@MSF) August 1, 2023

1686360616435351553.html:
Our logistical teams were also supporting the hospital by refurbishing the emergency bunker for the patients and medical staff  – a sad reminder that even hospitals aren't spared by the ongoing strikes.

— MSF International (@MSF) August 1, 2023

1686360618981277696.html:
The shells were reportedly fired by Russian forces. This hospital caters largely to stroke victims, patients with cardiac issues, and the provision of general surgical care. Our teams continue to support the hospital...

— MSF International (@MSF) August 1, 2023

1686360621661421568.html:
We unequivocally condemn this disgraceful attack on a medical facility and extend our condolences to the family of the doctor who died.
